column6: Number of land animals slaughtered for meat per year
column7: This data is based on the country of production, not consumption.

column7: This data is based on the country of production, not consumption.

column6: Number of wild-caught fish killed for food
column7: Estimates of the number of wild fish killed per year are uncertain – that's why upper and lower-bound estimates are shown. This data is calculated based on annual catch figures from 2007 to 2016 in tonnes, and estimated mean weights for fish species.
column8: This estimate does not include unrecorded fish capture, such as fish caught illegally and those caught as bycatch and discards.

column6: Number of wild-caught fish killed for food per person
column7: Estimates of the number of wild fish killed per year are uncertain – that's why upper and lower-bound estimates are shown. This data is calculated based on annual catch figures from 2007 to 2016 in tonnes, and estimated mean weights for fish species.
column8: This estimate does not include unrecorded fish capture, such as fish caught illegally and those caught as bycatch and discards.

column6: Number of farmed fish killed for food
column7: Estimates of the number of farmed fish killed per year are uncertain – that's why upper and lower-bound estimates are shown.
column8: Data does not include lobsters, farmed fish used as bait, and species without estimates of mean weight (which could be an additional 17% of fish production).

column6: Number of farmed fish killed for food per person
column7: Estimates of the number of farmed fish killed per year are uncertain – that's why upper and lower-bound estimates are shown.
column8: Data does not include lobsters, farmed fish used as bait, and species without estimates of mean weight (which could be an additional 17% of fish production).

column6: Number of farmed crustaceans killed for food
column7: Decapod crustaceans are animals such as shrimps, crabs, lobsters, prawns, and crayfish. Estimates are uncertain – that's why upper and lower-bound estimates are shown.

column7: Chick culling is the process of separating and killing unwanted male and unhealthy female chicks that cannot produce eggs in industrialized egg facilities.
Bullfighting is a physical contest that involves a bullfighter attempting to subdue, immobilize, or kill a bull.
